Austin Powers Dr Evil.Action: Spares the lives of Mustafa and Frau Farbissina because he needs their help.
Punishes failure by dropping associates into a pit.
Gives a two-handed handshake to a Mod Freak, salutes a Bobby, interacts excitedly with two beautiful Mod girls, encourages models during a photo shoot with friendly and enthusiastic comments.
Takes photographs of models in a professional manner, directs them effectively, and completes a photo shoot successfully.
Throws the camera in the air carelessly, requiring an assistant to catch it before it hits the ground.
Responds playfully and flirtatiously to supermodels, engages in lighthearted banter.
Runs away from adoring fans and mob of girls, avoiding direct interaction.
Attempts to make a stoic guard laugh by playful antics and giving a flower, resulting in shared laughter.
Makes a friendly, humorous comment to a pregnant hippy protester, sharing a laugh.
Runs away from a mob of fans and bad guys, uses judo chops to fend off attackers, disguises himself with a beard, and uses humor to engage a guard.
Runs away repeatedly instead of confronting or resolving situations directly.
Flips a coin into a blind man's cup, then knees him in the groin after revealing the man is not truly blind.
Engages playfully with schoolgirls chasing him, then escapes with the help of Mrs. Kensington.
Greets Mrs. Kensington warmly and cooperates with British Intelligence.
Flips a coin into a blind man's cup and then knees him in the balls after revealing the man is not really blind.
Escapes a crowd of schoolgirls by jumping into a moving convertible driven by his associate.
Uses a picture phone in the glove compartment to receive a call from British Intelligence.
Greets Mick Jagger warmly and encourages his song idea.
Offers Andy Warhol a can of soup when he says he is hungry.
Responds good-naturedly to Andy Warhol's claims of not giving credit.
Turns around and shows wounded bum to the queen in a cheeky, humorous way.
Punches a pretty mod girl in the face to reveal she is a male assassin.
Dr. Evil bids farewell to Mr. Bigglesworth and freezes himself to escape, showing a dramatic but affectionate gesture toward his cat.
Dr. Evil threatens to return when 'free love is dead, and greed and avarice once again rule the world,' indicating a cynical and malevolent worldview.
Dr. Evil initiates cryogenic freezing and launches himself into space to escape capture.
Successfully evades Austin Powers by using a high-tech escape plan involving a rocket disguised as a Bob's Big Boy.
Leaves behind a dramatic farewell message indicating future plans to return.
Appears vulnerable and uncomfortable upon reanimation, covering himself modestly and showing a natural human reaction to cold.
No direct interaction or expression of friendliness, trustworthiness, or sincerity in this excerpt; mostly passive and undergoing procedures.
Is found naked and frozen in cryogenic storage, requiring extensive reanimation and cleansing procedures.
Appears disoriented and vulnerable upon reanimation, showing no immediate signs of skill or confidence.
Expresses enthusiasm and friendliness towards former enemies, calling them 'Comrades' and complimenting a Russian officer's tie.
Shouts and struggles to control his voice during unfreezing, showing vulnerability and openness.
Shows excitement to begin work against Dr. Evil, indicating commitment and readiness.
Expresses awkwardness and self-awareness about his inappropriate thoughts and speech around Vanessa Kensington.
Makes a crude comment about Vanessa's body and sexual behavior.
Shows polite interest in Vanessa's mother and attempts light humor.
Austin shows self-awareness about his awkwardness and attempts humor to navigate social situations.
Austin makes inappropriate and distracting comments during a professional introduction, causing uncomfortable silence.
Responds to clerk's embarrassing reading with humor and lightheartedness, signs the book to keep things moving.
Shows embarrassment and confusion over personal effects, fails to deny ownership of incriminating items convincingly.
Shows excitement about the private jet and engages Vanessa in conversation about her background.
Makes a crude sexual advance towards Vanessa shortly after meeting her.
Shows excitement about the private jet and engages in casual, inappropriate conversation instead of focusing on the mission.
Does not demonstrate any strategic or skillful behavior in this excerpt; mostly engages in frivolous banter.
Uses outdated and offensive racial terms, makes inappropriate sexual comments to flight attendants.
Compliments a flight attendant by calling her a 'fabulous bird' and asks for her phone number.
Fails to concentrate on the mission, distracted by sexual innuendo and inappropriate comments.
Attempts to engage with flight attendants but misreads social cues and uses outdated/offensive language.
Flirts with the flight attendant and Vanessa despite clear rejection and chilly responses.
Maintains a playful and upbeat attitude even after being rejected.
Writes down the phone number for the flight crew and prepares for take-off.
Makes inappropriate and oblivious sexual advances despite clear rejection.
Fails to pick up on social cues and warnings from Vanessa about his behavior.
Dr. Evil is linked to a company (Virtucon) involved in suspicious activities, indicating a strategic front for his operations.
Dr. Evil's face remains unseen while making a dramatic reappearance, suggesting a calculated and confident return to villainy.
Expresses self-pity about being 'only half a man' and a 'freak'.
Harshly punishes Mustafa by tipping his chair into a pit after a minor failure.
Silences Mustafa abruptly and shows intolerance for failure.
Acknowledges a technical error in his plan and expresses frustration about being only partially frozen.
Demonstrates intolerance for failure by punishing Mustafa harshly for the technical flaw.
Fails to anticipate or prevent complications in the reanimation process affecting Mr. Bigglesworth.
Ignores Mustafa's cries for help and shoots him multiple times without remorse.
Introduces members of his Evil Cabinet in a businesslike, detached manner.
Thanks Random Task after he throws his shoe and knocks off a sculpture's head.
Describes Patty O'Brien's superstition and the charm bracelet with a dry tone, while others laugh at Patty's joke.
Acknowledges Number Two's role and loyalty in running the legitimate side of his empire.
Commands Random Task to demonstrate his skill, showing leadership and delegation.
Acknowledges and introduces his team members with detailed descriptions, indicating organizational control and awareness.
Fails to suppress laughter at Patty O'Brien's joke, showing a lapse in maintaining a serious, professional atmosphere.
Uses a conference table that rotates to reveal a strategic map, demonstrating planning and strategic thinking.
Proposes a blackmail plan targeting the Royal Family, showing disregard for others' privacy and well-being.
Expresses frustration about being uninformed due to long absence, admits lack of current knowledge.
Proposes a plan to hold the world hostage for ransom using nuclear weapons, showing disregard for global safety.
Responds to suggestions about ransom amount with irritation and sarcasm, showing little openness or friendliness.
Shows slight surprise and engages briefly in conversation about money, indicating some social engagement but not warmth.
Acknowledges the introduction of his son with neutral curiosity, no clear warmth or coldness.
Proposes a plan to use a laser to punch a hole in the ozone layer to extort the world for ransom.
Ignores the fact that the ozone layer hole has already happened, showing a lack of updated knowledge.
Reverts to a more traditional plan of hijacking nuclear weapons to hold the world hostage.
Insists on demanding only one million dollars ransom initially, which is a very low and unrealistic amount.
Reluctantly increases ransom demand to five million dollars after being advised, still far below what his company makes.
Shows some awareness of his company's financial power when corrected about revenue, but does not adjust ransom demand accordingly.
Dr. Evil expresses excitement and emotional joy upon meeting his son Scott, saying 'I have a son! I have a son!'
Dr. Evil gestures to the globe and tells Scott that someday the world will be his, indicating a desire to share legacy and future with his son.
Despite Scott's hostility ('I hate you!'), Dr. Evil does not respond with anger or rejection in this excerpt.
Austin jokes about the dental products being weapons, showing a playful and friendly interaction with Vanessa.
Makes a joking, somewhat crude comment to Vanessa and then acknowledges it was a joke, leading to shared laughter.
Mocks Vanessa's organized packing by calling her a 'nerd alert'.
Engages in light teasing and playful banter with Vanessa, showing a relaxed and friendly interaction.
Pulls out a vintage 1967 Playboy and a bottle of Jurgens lotion from luggage, shows lack of seriousness and focus.
Pulls out a Swedish penis enlarger pump and denies ownership, indicating immaturity and lack of responsibility.
Gives people two-handed handshakes while walking through the casino, despite being stared at like a freak.
Whispers to Vanessa about getting an answering machine, showing consideration and sharing information.
Uses a cover name to avoid drawing attention, showing prudence but also a lack of openness.
Politely asks Number Two if he may join the table, and is welcomed.
Uses a cover name to avoid drawing attention, showing awareness of undercover tactics.
Casually dials phone and quickly identifies an answering machine, indicating situational awareness.
Engages confidently with high-rollers at the casino, demonstrating social ease and confidence.
Makes a joke about x-ray glasses, showing humor but possibly undermining seriousness.
Quietly admits to Vanessa that he can't see through the X-ray glasses and panics before making a risky move in the game.
Introduces himself with a false name and mistakenly shakes a woman's breast instead of a hand, causing awkwardness.
Attempts to engage Number Two in a friendly handshake and social interaction despite the awkwardness.
Austin greets the Texan in the bathroom with friendly banter and responds warmly.
Austin uses charm bracelet and physical struggle to escape Patty O'Brien's attack.
Uses his thumbs to prevent strangulation by garrote wire, showing quick thinking and physical skill under pressure.
Engages in a bathroom stall confrontation where he is caught off guard and nearly strangled.
Drops Patty O'Brien's head into the toilet and flushes, causing her apparent death.
Reaches into Patty O'Brien's wallet to retrieve ID and business card after incapacitating her.
Breaks free of the charm bracelet/garotte and uses a brutal but effective interrogation technique to extract information.
Successfully obtains Dr. Evil's ID card and business card from Patty O'Brien's wallet, gaining valuable intelligence.
Leaves Patty O'Brien's dead body head-first in the toilet, showing a ruthless but pragmatic approach to his mission.
Tries to charm Vanessa persistently but is playful rather than aggressive.
Appears naked and unabashed, showing a humorous and open nature.
No direct interaction with Vanessa's mother or others in this excerpt; no hostile or cold behavior shown.
Austin is described as loyal and caring by Mrs. Kensington.
Austin greets Vanessa cheerfully and playfully, showing familiarity and warmth.
Shares a humorous story to explain his cautious approach during the stakeout.
Refuses to rush into action despite Vanessa's insistence, showing patience and consideration.
Identifies Dr. Evil's cat from a distance using a telephoto lens and remembers the cat distinctly.
Assesses the security situation realistically and advises against immediate action due to heavy protection.
Uses a confusing and irrelevant metaphor instead of clearly explaining his reasoning to Vanessa.
Compliments Vanessa sincerely and encourages her during the photo shoot, making her feel beautiful and confident.
While Dr. Evil escapes, Austin remains calm and plans to contact Basil for help.
Austin conducts a professional photo shoot with Vanessa, skillfully directing her poses and expressions, showing confidence and control.
Austin ignores Vanessa's discomfort with having her picture taken and pushes her to pose more provocatively.
Offers Vanessa a tiny piece of sausage, shares a formal dinner, laughs and dances with her, gives her roses and a pet rock, enjoys her company, plays Twister and laughs together.
Engages in playful, silly miming games with Vanessa, making her laugh and enjoy herself.
Apologizes to Vanessa for the death of her 'bug up her ass', showing sensitivity to her feelings.
Pulls away from a potential kiss because Vanessa is drunk, showing respect and care for her well-being.
Mimes going down stairs, taking escalator, and rowing a canoe behind the couch to entertain Vanessa.
Engages in playful banter and humor, showing social ease and confidence.
Pulls away from a kiss because Vanessa is drunk, showing awareness and responsibility.
Reflects sentimentally on love and family, acknowledging another's love for his mother.
Shows concern for Vanessa by noting she is working on another lead.
Responds politely and appreciatively to Basil Exposition's warnings and advice.
Responds promptly and professionally to a mission briefing from British Intelligence, acknowledges potential side effects of unfreezing, and prepares to act on a lead.
Allows Vanessa to continue working on a lead alone, indicating trust but also potential risk in going solo.
Uses playful and flirtatious language with Alotta, asking permission to call her by her first name.
Responds smugly and sarcastically to Alotta's surprise and questions.
Photographs the dossier with a miniature camera pendant, capturing detailed information about Virtucon's holdings and secret projects.
Misinterprets or feigns knowledge about Virtucon's subterranean drills, admitting he only knows because Alotta told him.
Engages in flirtatious banter with Alotta, potentially distracting from the business at hand.
Accepts Alotta's offer to wash his back and engages in friendly banter.
Shows trust by allowing Alotta to wash him and drink saki with her.
Does not notice or react to Alotta stealing and searching his wallet behind his back.
Fails to notice Alotta stealing his wallet and planting relaxation pills in his drink, becoming woozy.
Recites playful, silly poems to Alotta and engages in lighthearted, affectionate interaction.
Responds openly and humorously to Alotta's personal question about his teeth.
Engages in a fun, carefree dance with a go-go girl, showing sociability and friendliness.
Dr. Evil plots to neutralize Austin Powers, showing hostility and lack of trust.
Dr. Evil identifies Austin Powers as a threat and calls for his neutralization, showing awareness of the situation.
Refers to the Fembots as 'breathtaking' and appreciates their qualities, but objectifies them by focusing on their physical attributes and weaponry.
Commands the use of lethal androids to kill soldiers, showing ruthless and cold behavior.
Acknowledges the success of his plan with a calm and approving tone.
Approves and utilizes advanced android replicant technology (Fembots) as a strategic weapon against Austin Powers.
Successfully orchestrates a multi-phase plan involving the capture of a Russian warhead and initiates Phase Two confidently.
Makes a joke about the Fembots' 'caliber' that interrupts his otherwise serious demeanor.
Demands ransom from the UN representatives with escalating amounts, threatens to destroy the world, laughs maniacally.
Demands a ransom of one million dollars initially, then quickly raises it to one hundred billion dollars after realizing the amount is too low.
Attempts to intimidate the United Nations with a threat to destroy the world using a single warhead, despite being corrected that it is not possible.
Maintains confidence and control during the UN meeting, asserting his identity and setting a clear deadline for payment.
Fails to understand or accept the limitations of his weapon's destructive power, undermining his threat.
Laughs maniacally with evil associates, then awkwardly ends interaction and leaves them unsure what to do.

Announces a plan to become one-hundred billion dollars richer in five days with maniacal laughter, but then awkwardly pauses and ends the meeting by deciding to watch TV, leaving associates unsure how to proceed.
Punches an elderly lady in the face and tugs her hair, mistaking her for a man.
Punches a frail elderly lady mistakenly thinking she is a man, causing confusion and distress.
Makes disparaging remarks about Basil's mother, calling her mannish and comparing her to a man in drag.
Admits openly to Vanessa that he was unfaithful and 'shagged' another woman, showing blunt honesty.
Responds to Vanessa's jealousy and insecurity with frankness rather than reassurance or sensitivity.
Misidentifies Basil's mother as a man and makes insensitive remarks about her appearance.
Dismisses Vanessa's feelings and openly admits to infidelity without tact or consideration.
Responds to Vanessa's concern about protection with a joke rather than a serious answer.
Says 'It was just a shag, Vanessa. You're everything to me.'
Dismisses Vanessa's concerns about fidelity and safe sex, calling others 'filthy beggars' and showing disregard for her feelings.
Looks at his address book with names crossed out and comments, showing a somewhat cynical or detached attitude toward others.
Reflects alone in his hotel room, looking at old and new shoes, listening to music, and playing video games, showing loneliness and vulnerability.
Pumps new Reebok shoes too much and they explode.
Microwaves unopened can of soup, causing it to explode.
Plays a video game and is frightened by the violent outcome.
Drinks alone and sad, tries to connect with young people by raising a bottle in a friendly gesture
Pleased by sarcastic peace signs from young people who look at him like a freak
Greets Vanessa warmly and engages in casual conversation
Keeps relationship strictly professional when Vanessa suggests it
Attempts to use the Water Pik but fails as the head is too loose and water sprays everywhere.
Drives alone and sad, showing emotional vulnerability but no particular skill or confidence.
Attempts to socially engage with young people by raising a bottle of ZIMA, but is met with sarcastic responses; he is pleased with himself despite social failure.
Engages in watching a historical video and discusses current events with Vanessa, showing some awareness and conversational ability.
Maintains a professional boundary with Vanessa when she states the relationship should remain professional.
Acknowledges his evil nature honestly in group therapy.
Pressures Scott to take over the family business and world domination.
Mocks Scott's career aspirations (vet, petting zoo) with sarcastic comments.
Introduces himself confidently as Dr. Evil to the group.
Insists on the importance of his role in taking over the world when he dies.
Engages in repetitive wordplay with Scott (e.g., 'evil vet', 'evil petting zoo'), which frustrates Scott.
Acknowledges his own evil nature honestly in therapy.
Admits to trying to kill his son Scott Evil openly in therapy, showing brutal honesty but lack of warmth.
Shares details of his difficult and unusual childhood in therapy when encouraged, showing some openness and willingness to engage.
Tries to calm Vanessa down and explains his behavior as part of his job, attempting to avoid conflict.
Dismisses Vanessa's feelings by calling her 'trippy' and refuses to engage deeply with her insecurities.
Attended evil medical school at age eighteen.
Engages in petty personal arguments during a professional tour.
Makes a lighthearted joke about the guru's death while reassuring Vanessa about mind control technique.
Takes initiative to help Vanessa by using disguise and mind control to bypass security.
Successfully infiltrates a restricted area by knocking out personnel and disguising himself in coveralls that fit perfectly.
Confidently claims to use a mind control technique learned from a guru to bypass security despite obvious lack of resemblance to photo badges.
Uses mind control on the guard to gain access, including manipulating him to give up his last piece of gum and promising to get sherbert.
Protects Vanessa by fighting off multiple scientists and security guards to ensure their escape.
Uses violence and deception (knocking out drivers) to escape.
Frantically jerks the steering wheel, tries to downshift and brake to avoid the steamroller, but the shifter breaks off and he fails to stop in time, resulting in a guard being run over.
After escaping the immediate danger, he quickly moves with Vanessa to the hallway and tries to act naturally to avoid suspicion.
Indirectly causes death of henchman Steve Harwin, no shown remorse or personal outreach to family.
Maintains a private army with henchmen who risk their lives for him.
Welcomes Vanessa politely and acknowledges her presence by name.
Squeezes a tennis ball repeatedly, showing signs of stress or agitation.
Makes a sarcastic comment about shaking hands 'except for obvious reasons' due to his injured hand.
Expresses insecurity about his hand, calling himself a freak.
Dr. Evil commands his subordinates to check on the guests and maintains control over his underground lair, showing organized leadership.
Dr. Evil squeezes a tennis ball repeatedly, a nervous or trivial action that may indicate lack of calm confidence.
Dr. Evil shows his supposedly useless hand to intimidate or gain sympathy, but the hand appears virtually normal, undermining his intended effect.
Dismisses Austin's attempt to understand him, speaks with cold finality about his plan.
Presents a destructive weapon to the United Nations with no regard for human life.
Invites Mr. Powers to join for dinner, serves food prepared by his chef.
Greets Scott affectionately as 'my boy' and asks about his day.
Tries to hide contempt when Scott describes a fight at the arcade.
Sets a clear deadline and gives instructions to the United Nations, demonstrating control over the situation.
Engages in casual dinner conversation and jokes about his chef being made of plastic, showing confidence and composure.
Tries to hide contempt when listening to Scott's story, indicating some emotional control but possible difficulty in managing personal relationships.
Slaps away Scott Evil's hand to prevent impulsive violence, showing some restraint.
Refers to Scott Evil as 'Daddy's nemesis' in a teasing manner.
Threatens to kill Austin Powers and Vanessa in an elaborate, torturous way.
Dismisses Scott Evil's concerns harshly by grounding him.
Coldly states he will kill people even after they pay him, showing ruthlessness.
Says every creature deserves a warm meal before releasing sharks with laser beams on their heads to attack Austin.
Responds impatiently and dismissively to Frau Farbissina's concerns and explanations about the sharks and piranhas.
Dismisses Scott Evil's concern about the sea bass dying and closes the tank without watching them.
Uses toothpaste to help Vanessa escape danger, protects her by fighting the guard, shares light-hearted banter with Vanessa after the fight.
Uses dental floss skillfully as a grappling hook and escape tool, coordinates with Vanessa to distract the guard, and escapes danger by sliding down the floss.
Engages in a physical struggle with the guard and manages to flip him over despite being pinned, showing quick thinking and physical capability.
Makes multiple puns during a life-threatening situation, which could be seen as a distraction or lack of seriousness.
Has a private army with henchmen like John Smith, who is respected and loved by his friends.
Admits to Vanessa that he feels bad about cheating and expresses love sincerely.
Encourages Vanessa to lead the troops and shows trust in her abilities.
Austin stays behind to keep an eye on the bad Doctor while sending Vanessa to get help, showing situational awareness and delegation.
Austin attempts a twenty-seven point turn in a narrow corridor to turn the golf cart around, indicating difficulty with a simple maneuver.
Dr. Evil tries to engage Scott Evil by inviting him to see what he does for a living.
Dr. Evil ignores Scott Evil's rude underbreath comment and continues the conversation.
Scott Evil responds rudely to Dr. Evil, indicating tension in their relationship.
Dr. Evil confidently commands the group to proceed to the main chamber and initiates Project Vulcan by arming the probe and preparing the nuclear warhead.
Scott Evil refuses to participate and shows disrespect, indicating Dr. Evil's difficulty in managing his own team effectively.
Dr. Evil attempts to engage Scott Evil by appealing to his curiosity about his work, showing some leadership effort.
Commands the arming and loading of a nuclear warhead with precision and control.
Dr. Evil commands the arming and loading of the nuclear warhead onto the probe, coordinates technicians, and initiates the penetration countdown with confidence.
Relies on technicians to carry out technical tasks without direct involvement, showing delegation but no direct technical skill demonstrated.
Mouths 'I love you' to a Fembot whose head then explodes.

Tries to explain the situation to Vanessa and she believes him.
Shows concern for Vanessa's feelings when she looks hurt.

Disguises pain while grinding cigarette with bare foot and maintains composure during chaotic situation.
Appears vulnerable and in briefs when Vanessa and commandos arrive, but quickly regains control and explains situation calmly.
Leads Vanessa and commandos into main chamber where gunfire breaks out, indicating readiness to engage in combat.
Commands to activate blast shutters and launch subterranean probe promptly upon alarm.
Successfully initiates a powerful subterranean probe causing a violent quake.
Relies on heavy security and technology to defend against intruders.
Austin insists on going alone, telling Vanessa to secure the perimeter.
Austin compliments the Destructacon 5000's intelligence with a friendly quip.
Complains about being hit by a shoe and insults the thrower by saying 'You fight like a woman.'
Attempts to stop a subterranean detonation by locating and reaching the abort button under pressure.
Runs out of bullets and is hit by a thrown shoe, momentarily distracted and insulted the attacker instead of focusing on the task.
Pauses after being hit by the shoe instead of immediately continuing to the abort button, losing valuable time.
Throws a drink to electrocute an enemy, then saves the world by aborting a catastrophic explosion.
Chases Dr. Evil to stop his plans, confronts him directly.
Dr. Evil makes a self-deprecating joke comparing himself to Austin.
Acknowledges shared traits with Austin despite differences.
Dismisses Austin's ideals as pathetic and calls him an aging hipster.
Commands to kill his own son Scott without hesitation.
Expresses concern when Scott says he hates him.

Austin shoots at the rocket but misses, then quickly decides to escape with Vanessa.
Expresses love sincerely to Vanessa and embraces her warmly.
Responds appreciatively and congratulates Vanessa on her promotion.
Receives a business card from Basil with light humor, showing friendly rapport.
Austin successfully stops Dr. Evil from destroying the world with his subterranean nuclear probe and escapes unscathed from the evil lair.
Responds to Basil Exposition's serious briefing with a casual, humorous remark ('I'd say that about sums it up, Exposition.'), showing confidence but a lack of formal seriousness.
Accepts a business card for a dentist from Basil instead of a more relevant or serious reward or information.
Austin kisses Vanessa tenderly and shows care by signaling Basil to be lifted safely by the helicopter pilot.
Dr. Evil threatens the world with death instead of ransom.
Dr. Evil's capsule is shown in orbit around the Earth, indicating he has the capability to launch and maintain a space-based lair.
Dr. Evil confidently declares he expects the world to die rather than pay ransom, showing boldness but possibly overconfidence or lack of subtlety.
